author: Words64
title: Not getting through on the phone
body:
I appreciate GP practices can be busy at times but I can never get through on the phone. It seems to be 90% of the time on an answering machine saying to call the next day or their message box is full.  
I was sent a letter by the nurse of the practice to ring her for blood results and change of medication and it took me 2.5 weeks to get through and that was because I pushed the button for blood results. When I got through, they didn't have the results so asked them to put me through to the nurse. I had to make an appointment for 2 weeks later for the nurse to telephone me at a time during work hours however as it took so long I took the call.  
My mother is 88 years of age and has the same problem so asks me to call for her. My daughter has eczema and ran out of cream and as there is an option for repeat prescriptions, ordered a repeat as she could not get through to a receptionist to make an appointment with the doctor.  
When she went to collect it from the pharmacy it wasn't there. The pharmacy had to go and ask them and she was told that she had to have a review with the GP and to ring the practice. She has not got through and that has been ringing the practice every day for 2 weeks, every half hour because her hands are so sore and needs the cream. She was in tears this evening and asked me to ring for her tomorrow. I know I won't get through but I will ring from 8.30 am and will continue to ring, but from experience if not engaged, it will go to the recorded message to call again the next day at 8.30 am.  
The problem is everyone then calls again at 8.30 am. Fortunately I work from home 3 days a week so can do this from home, but how can patients ring if they work or use the work phones or their mobiles whilst at work? We could go at lunchtime, however they close at lunch. I didn't realise this and was waiting to speak and approached the desk, when the receptionist blanked me when I spoke, and rudely lowered the shutters without a word or explanation knowing I had been waiting to speak to them and to pick up a prescription.  
This rudeness and bad attitude is not what patients need who are already stressed trying to rush out during lunch hour as they can't get them on the phone. Do these receptionists get trained on customer care, or how to communicate? All they had to say was sorry, we are closed now for lunch. Not push a button and saying nothing and then walk away. I now realise they close for lunch. There seem a good team of at least half a dozen back office staff so why can't staggered lunches be arranged or can staff not be rotated so that phones are covered between working hours?  
I have high blood pressure and needed medication changed due to side effects of a new drug and it took me a total of 5 weeks to get to speak to the nurse, and this was not her fault, or even the receptionist's. There seems to be no proper systems in place to cover all the work and ensuring phones are answered. Are practice management and GPs aware that patients get an answering machine the majority of the time?  
I dread having to make an appointment now and feel like they are doing me a favour to even speak to a nurse or doctor. I appreciate they are busy but I am not a patient that is constantly looking to speak to a Dr or nurse. I was written to and texted to ring the practice but the stress and time involved resulted in me not bothering.  
I did get through to the nurse eventually as I say, after waiting 2 weeks after I finally got through to reception. I have expressed this with friends, family and colleagues and this is not an isolated occurrence. All patients of this practice have reported the same, not getting through on the phone, prescriptions being ordered but not left, elderly patients travelling by taxi to see the dr as couldn't get through on the phone and distressed.  
I know funding etc is low and I appreciate the health service and certainly don't take advantage of it or complain, but when it is affecting being seen by health professionals when necessary, it could be dangerous. I already take my own and monitor my own bp and try to manage my cholesterol levels etc and only I asked about my sugar level (due to family type 2 diabetes), it was highlighted that it was pre-diabetic and high. No one had picked this up.  
It's concerning not only for myself but for all the other patients in this practice. I am concerned for my mother and other elderly patients who cannot get through on the phone when they need medication or advice. My daughter is currently suffering with her skin on her hands because she simply cannot get through on the phone and no point going into the practice because they say to ring at 8.30 am for appointments. Can the practice manager and GPs please be made aware of this and would welcome their comments. Thank you for offering this service and for listening.

readBy.name: Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: unhgf54
title: Hampton Wick Surgery poor service
body:
From my experience this surgery fails its duty of care. They do not care about their patients. They never follow up the "4 working days" rule from their website when you contact them and they ignore complaints. Who is not tired of the nearly two minutes long message when you call them?  
The receptionists, who are not doctors, are too nosey when asking about symptoms etc to get a chance to be put on the call list. They are still not fully back to face-to-face appointments. A minimum of three weeks to get a blood test – as they changed their booking system – is a joke. They keep messing up with my prescriptions and do not follow consultant’s recommendations. They do not care that you suffer because you are out of medicine for a couple of days because they didn’t deal with your regular prescription.  
One partner had a told me off me once as I did not pick up the phone when the GP called me two hours late! I am not glued to my phone and may need the bathroom. I shouldn’t be blamed because the doctor didn't respect the appointment time. I needed a supply of my medicine for my holidays abroad. I spoke to two doctors a month before, I messaged the surgery several times explaining the deadline with the pharmacy and for one week I went to the surgery every single day, nothing was sorted. The receptionists kept telling me it would be done on the same day. It is very worrying that a surgery cannot get the right medicine or give you medicine on time as well as not calling back. My health is worse because of their lack of care and unprofessionalism.

author: Needs Not Met Patient
title: Distressed, angry and confused
body:
I recently had a particularly unpleasant experience at my GP Practice when I attended for my cervical screening test.  
I have emailed my complaint to the Practice Manager of Sydenham Green Group Practice twice but have not received any responses to date.  
I have been a patient at Sydenham Green Group Practice for years and have never had any issues or made any complaints until now. In recent months, I have experienced highly stressful and unpleasant encounters with some of the staff at the Sydenham Green Group Practice.  
My recent visit with the nurse was dreadful. I arrived on time and checked in. It turned out that while I was waiting, my nurse ate into my appointment time by stopping to have a lengthy casual chat with one of her colleagues.  
Having had a unfruitful and frustrating conversation with one of the receptionists, the nurse could see that I was not ok. I told them that I was unhappy and frustrated with the care and treatment I had been getting from the practice recently. They appeared to be sympathetic and then assumed a position as if they were going to commence my appointment. I was getting myself ready when the nurse turned to me and told me not to be rude to them.  
I was taken aback by their remark because all I had done was let them know why I was frustrated since they had asked. The nurse accused me of being rude, having an attitude and taking it out on them. I most certainly did not and was not. I tried to tell them that but they just kept talking over me. Not being able to think, I drowned their words out with the silence in my head. Then the nurse said they would not see me if I continued to have an attitude. I was bewildered. So I picked up my bag and walked out. As I was walking away, the nurse called out after me stating that I could take 5 minutes to calm down and come back in if I wanted to. What a joke. Did they really expect me to let them perform a smear test on me after that deplorable barrage of accusations.  
I have a hidden disability and because I am vulnerable at the best of times, I try my hardest to avoid stress at all costs. Distressed, angry and confused, I left the GP practice feeling far worse off than when I had arrived. My symptoms flared up for several days after and my medical needs were not met.

author: aurigagm63
title: Appointment system is very concerning
body:
Writing this hoping GP practice listens and changes.  
We understand about pressures in NHS as many in our family and extended family are NHS professionals. We don't call the GP /NHS 111/999 unless there is absolutely no other option. But we also have very vulnerable young and older family who have needed a GP appointment and to be seen and have been refused or declined. And as a direct result ended up admitted to hospital and the GP and NHS 111 have both ordered emergency ambulances . These are 2 examples and we could include more . This has now gone on for well over 2 years.  
My very young daughter has a serious condition and there is a treatment plan from the hospital with the GP as is NHS policy . This is because if not treated in time she will become very unwell with a very high temperature and breathing difficulties and it is there to stop this from happening. She has now been admitted 5 times after numerous attempts to get a planned GP face to face appointment where the GP could have physically examined and the treatment plan followed. This is extremely distressing for her.  
My dad has had a stroke plus he has serious lung disease and cannot communicate on the telephone to explain when he is unwell. He has been refused telephone appointments by reception and they cant tell us why and they don't keep track of how many are told no appointment, and if they did the practice would have a better idea of how the appointment system is failing .Then telephoned by GPs who didn't recognise the need for him to be seen. He lives alone and him even trying to call should have been a red flag. The GP practice insists on a system where every single patient has to be telephone assessed by a GP to decide if they need to be seen. It is extremely stressful to try and ever contact the practice over anything.It is an extension of what happened at the height of covid and we don't feel they have learnt anything about what happens when you don't see patients.Patients now know if they can't manage a telephone appointment - we have all learnt this from NHS lockdown and this should be respected and you can't assess someone safely unless there is clear 2 way communication. You can't even get any appointments planned, or emergency appointments most days, and when you double up in this way then it seems obvious that the capacity to operate safely is pushed to the maximum when it shouldn't be. The online consult system never worked when we tried it and now is at best open 2/24 hrs a day. This telephone triage system seems to be there for very simple illnesses only and everyone else with chronic conditions have to wait until it reaches health emergency status. This is our lived experience.Strep A outbreak and industrial action means they have decided now to refuse all planned appointments and tell everyone who cant get an emergency appointment to ring 999 or go to A&E as they can't offer duty GP appointments most days. When the ambulance service and nurses and other hospital staff are on strike. If they stopped this system then appointments would be better utilised- our family is an example that should be learnt from.We have told the practice managers this and the individual GPs but after years of absent GPs we are at the stage of absolute desperation at times and that is from a position of being better informed than others.Sad, frightening and traumatic for our daughter in particular and for us as parents and caretakers.

author: Elsl
title: Staff attitude
body: I had an appointment with my baby to see the Doctor. I found the staff very rude and I did not like their attitude.

author: Granny R
title: Lack of liaison in my grandson's WestMARC experience
body:
My grandson’s experience with WestMARC was a rough journey. We have been in touch with the service manager for WestMARC and quotes are lifted directly from her response.  
**The beginning**  
Our local physiotherapist referred my grandson to WestMARC aged three in 2020, requesting a wheelchair and sharing information with his mother on the type of mobility aid she was considering.  
At this point, my grandson could sit unsupported, but could not crawl, stand or take any steps.  
At assessment, WestMARC informed my daughter that they considered the requested aid an “overprescription” and instead recommended a buggy. My daughter was persuaded that this was lighter and more convenient. This was the only mobility aid he had through two years at nursery. In contrast, nursery and home received excellent support from the local OT and physio AHP team, including access to well fitted adjustable supportive seating at home and at school, which was updated as he grew.  
**The middle**  
At his final episode of physiotherapy in the community before starting school, from January to April 2022, his local physio again recommended contacting WestMARC for consideration of a wheelchair.  
At age 4 1/2 my grandson was still unable to crawl, stand or take steps.  
The implication of this was that school transport could not transition him safely into a taxi and a wheelchair would be required for bus transport. In addition after two years of daily use his lightweight buggy was falling to pieces. The local physiotherapist advised that WestMARC was likely to be more responsive to a family and suggested contacting them directly.  
Unfortunately, my daughter did not do this immediately, being unaware of the waits currently, but did make contact as advised at the start of the school summer break. WestMARC said “we are reliant on information from referrals into our service to identify appropriate stakeholders in the patient’s care and where this information is provided it is documented to allow us to invite the stakeholders to appointments where possible“.  
WestMARC also say their service is a “specialist area“. There is no doubt that their team does require highly technical knowledge and competencies to deal with the complex aids they supply, however, my grandson‘s local team are also skilled clinicians who know him well, and this discounts the most specialist person in his life – his mother.  
In my grandson‘s case, his original local physiotherapist was clearly not part of the assessment and prescription process in the first place, and my daughter was not asked about local AHP stakeholders when she re-contacted their service.  
School transport as predicted has not been possible, although his local council have made it available. We cannot use it and for the past six months have been forced to transport him to and from his specialist school, which is 5 miles from their home.  
It is now my belief that my grandson‘s buggy may never have been an appropriate mobility aid for him and certainly quickly became inappropriate.  
Had adequate liaison between WestMARC and the local AHP service happened at any point in the past two years the issues we have experienced could and should have been avoided  
WestMARC said “the WestMARC team would welcome improved collaborative working. This is limited by clinical capacity. We agree that a team approach is always preferable to the smooth transition of patient’s clinical pathways and where these contacts are available to us, we will endeavour to work with them.”  
The corporate answer is clearly nothing like our families lived experience.  
**The end in sight?**  
My grandson waited five months before he was offered an appointment in November 2022. WestMARC said “we recognise the importance of continuity of care, particularly for paediatric patients and their families, and this is why we have clinicians allocated to specific areas to facilitate development of positive relationships.“ So in 2 1/2 years, he has now been seen twice. With this gap between appointments “positive relationships“ are impossible to develop, even without changes in the staff.  
At this appointment my daughter was asked about self propelling and accessing brakes. My grandson‘s profile includes a severe cortical visual impairment and profound learning difficulties. These questions demonstrated a very superficial understanding of his profile. Since he had been previously assessed by WestMARC this profile could and should have been available to the clinician. Alternatively in the five months we waited for an appointment any contact with his local physiotherapist before he was reviewed would’ve prevented my daughter from having to retell the story of my grandson’s distressing and complex challenges.  
At this appointment, finally, a wheelchair was prescribed. Of course this is not really the end of the story.  
WestMARC say “Pressures brought on by Brexit, Covid and supplies issues from overseas, also has an impact on medical device availability causing provisions delays to patients in some instances“. This definitely applies to my grandson.  
At his appointment, my daughter was advised that there would be a “6 to 8 week“ delay in provision of the device and of course, with the overlap with Christmas, the reality is a nine week delay. No early Christmas present for us.  
WestMARC say “funding is provided via a regional consortium of representatives of the six health board areas we cover“ and have “an active caseload of over 60,000 patients in Scotland“.  
I believe that WestMARC is too poorly resourced to be able to meet the needs of the population that it serves. As a regional service covering 6 health board areas, it is not proximal enough to the child at the centre, and the team around him, to be able to really “see” them.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Endeavor22
title: Myself and my husband
body:
Not able to make appointment after 30 minutes of trying to get through. Alternative offered was to ring 111 and then receptionist put the phone down.  
This service is seriously failing and needs to be addressed as I believe that there will be a number of people out there who are suffering as a result of this poor service!  
Interestingly, we have hosted a family from Ukraine and they have told us about people going back to a country where there is a war because they can’t get seen here by their GP’s!

author: aileen02
title: Waiting for a bed
body:
My dad has vascular dementia and was moved from ARU5 to ward 5D. However, on arrival at Ward 5D there was no bed. Apparently, also there is a man in front of us waiting for a bed, and has been waiting for four hours.  
This is unacceptable to ask any patient, never mind a patient with vascular dementia who needs familiarity and routine to function, to be allowed to wait in a hallway for a room with no toilet facilities either.  
This is a disgrace and certainly not in my dad's best interests.

author: ritwren147
title: Positive covid test and being extremely vulnerable
body: Being classed as extremely vulnerable, I contacted my GP right away when I tested positive. Thanks to my GP, who was very helpful and works in Kensington Medical Practice.They got in touch with The Mater Hospital and I received a phone call from Dr. Gemma within half an hour. She put me at ease right away and outlined the options that were open to me regarding antiviral treatments, which due to my medical problems I was eligible for. She took time to fully explain the potential side effects, how I would obtain the treatment and gave me time to ask questions. The following morning she rang again first thing to see how I was and within an hour had arranged for treatment to be picked up from the Mater Hospital Belfast. The pharmacist in the hospital rang me within another half hour and told me the treatment was ready for collection. I cannot thank everyone enough for their help during this incredibly stressful time.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Smckie
title: Thank you so much for helping us and keeping me calm and our daughter safe
body:
I was attending day care 3 times a week because my baby wasn’t growing and her placenta wasn’t working properly. I want to say a massive thank you to an amazing midwife who looked after me and kept me reassured especially when my scan results weren’t good. Her name is Toni.  
This midwife would go above and beyond no matter what and even when it was busy when I was upset she would sit and reassure me. She knew my background and why I was so anxious with this pregnancy. I had a gorgeous baby girl at 35 weeks and Toni even took the time to come and see me after my operation. This meant so much as she could meet our daughter.  
Thank you so much for helping us and keeping me calm and our daughter safe.

author: Gourock Service User
title: Cancer Diagnosis and support from primary care
body: I was diagnosed with terminal cancer this year.  Secondary care had been fantastic but I wanted to mention the support I have had from my primary care service.  The staff at Gourock health centre from reception to GPs and everyone in between have been accessible, responsive and supportive.  I know primary care is under so much pressure but they have never left me feeling like they do not have time for me.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: A thankful service user
title: The care they provided was exceptional
body:
I had the misfortune of breaking my ankle but the care that I received in the Royal Victoria Hospital from the second I came through the door was fantastic. From the staff in ED to the Nurse Practitioner and Physio staff in fracture clinic I knew that I was in good hands. My fracture required surgical fixation so I was admitted to ward 2E and I can not praise the ward staff highly enough. Even though they were rushed off their feet, nothing was too much for them - they even sang happy birthday to me as I was in hospital for my birthday. The care they provided was exceptional despite having extra beds opened on the ward and they always had time to listen to what was important to their patients and never made anyone feel that they were wasting their time and even joined in with some of the ‘interesting’ conversations that we were having in the bay.  
They encouraged their patients to be as independent as possible but were always ready to step in and help if needed.  
The 2E staff are truly amazing individuals and deserve more recognition than this brief message can possibly demonstrate.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bob4321
title: Wonderful wonderful service
body: My wife who is 74 had a trip in the house from which she hid her head on kitchen cupboard doors. Initially she said she was ok but within a few minutes she was very confused, sweaty and vague. Her pupils looked different ,she was extremely busy and could not stand up, very confused. Luckily my two daughters were at home that night and took things in hand. They discovered her blood pressure had dropped very low and decided it was a 999 call. Paramedics arrived within 30 minutes and gave a fantastic check over, bp heart check,blood check glucose. Fantastic people, made sure she was back to normal, all brought on by shock. Wonderful wonderful service from two lovely people.

author: Nanny Fe
title: We applaud all of you
body:
Our great granddaughter was seriously ill with HUS she had waited at Edinburgh Sick Kids for 2 weeks in an induced coma and on ventilator. She was admitted to QEUH on Xmas eve 2021 and remained there for a few days. The staff at all levels were fantastic. The staff at Ronald MacDonald in Glasgow were Fantastic. We, as a family cannot thank all the staff and doctors enough who looked after, cared and monitored her every minute of every dark day. You are such special dedicated people. We applaud all of you and we can never thank all of the staff for giving us back our very special little girl.  
Thank you all so so much you guys are fantastic!!!!!!!!  
Merry Xmas to you all xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

author: R1991
title: Just seeing her for 30 mins, meant a lot to me
body: I got to see my mum on Christmas Day, despite having covid - I appreciate that people were working today to make this happen. It was very difficult to be apart from her and I was worried about her after a few days of little contact. Just seeing her for 30 mins, even though we didn’t have lots of chat, meant a lot to me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Santa Claus
title: Repeatedly fobbed off
body:
I took my son to the urgent care department of West Cornwall Hospital recently, as he was in considerable pain. The department was closed due to sickness but we were told it would open at 09:00. Around 08:45 we were informed he could book in but when he tried, we were repeatedly fobbed off and told we should go to Camborne/Redruth or Treliske. They didn’t ever examine him and seemed to do everything possible not to.  
There was a security guard, a staff member on the desk, a second staff member, one nurse and a second receptionist, all appearing to do absolutely nothing. It appeared that the things lacking were a doctor….and some urgent care.  
Fortunately I was in a position to get him to Truro’s Royal Cornwall Hospital, where his care has been first class so far. It’s now the afternoon, but at least he’s been assessed, scanned and things are on the move forward.

author: normayn38
title: 8 hour plus wait
body:
I think it is absolutely sickening that my grandmother of 93 was considered a concern but that we were then made to wait 8 plus hours for the next set of triage.  
Stepping Hill should be ashamed of this waiting time.

title: Fantastic care
body: The nurse looking after my partner was amazing , stayin g long after the end if her shift and noticing important factors which made an enormous difference to my partners recovery and additional treatment. I am so grateful

author: avocetdb65
title: Smiling faces and cups of yummy tea
body:
I had recently found out that I had to have a full hysterectomy after discovering cancer cells in my uterus and was incredibly anxious about my up coming operation. However, upon arrival to ward 32 at the Royal Alexandria Hospital in Paisley I was put immediately at ease, the measuring and fitting of my lovely white stocking became a fun time, laughing at how awful they really were. The warm and welcoming staff at every level made a very worrisome event in my life a memorable one for very positive reasons, from smiling faces, cups of yummy tea and nothing is a bother attitude…..I honestly can’t thank everyone on ward 32 enough for making my short stay so positive from beginning to end. My memories going forward of a horrible and very stressful event in my life have now become an incredibly positive and warm one.  
Thank you everyone on Ward 32.

title: Brilliant service
body: The lady consultant was lovely and was very friendly. As was the other two nurses and the registrar, first class service

title: Filled in a consultation form online and response…
body: The doctor was very professional, caring and listened to what I had to say.  Also got a prescription the same day.  Excellent service from beginning to end.

title: Phenomenal patience and care
body:
We received the most spectacular care from a team of paramedics on Christmas Eve. They were prompt, kind, patient and persistent in trying to find the right teams to help when the service was already stretched to such an extent.
We couldn’t be more grateful for their service to others and for just being genuinely kind and caring people.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: centaurusfq67
title: Fabulous fabulous staff!
body: I was in Day Surgery after emergency surgery and the staff were incredible, they took such good care of me and everyone else around me. They kept our spirits up which we really needed as it was so close to Christmas. They answered any questions I had and kept me comfortable. They also dealt with issues with my medication being delivered by the porters/pharmacy and kept me and my husband informed as to what was happening and why we were being kept late. Any issues in paperwork they fixed and reassured me about. Fabulous fabulous staff!

title: Approachable, understanding and efficient
body: No problem with making an initial appointment, smooth and precise.  Had to cancel for personal reasons, but this was dealt with in a friendly manner, and a new date confirmed there and then. Impeccable service without question or any hint of a problem.  A truly pleasurable experience.  Thank you.

title: Keeping it real
body:
I have been registered with this surgery since birth. Like most people I sometimes struggle to get appointments, which is frustrating but I appreciate the doctor's have their own constraints. 
When able to see a doctor I find them pleasant and approachable, some more so than others. My health has not been brilliant this year but I can not or will not complain about the service received.
I have not heard of another surgery that is not problematic, so am happy to stay with the GP's at Norvic.
Some of the receptionists can be a bit curt but generally this has improved, my suggestion if you are unable to accommodate an appointment offer tactfully a suggestion ie, try 111.
The nurse and GP's have my vote. They are human also and like the rest of us have their own issues to deal with.

title: Good practice
body: With all the pressure the NHS is under from lack of funding, this branch does their best. Doctors are compassionate and knowledgeable. Reception is efficient and professional. I have always been able to get a phone appointment within a couple of days. Facility building itself is clean and relatively modern. Thank you to all the staff and solidarity with all striking for a living wage.

title: Amazing care
body: I called 111 as I was having trouble with my breathing as I have COPD.   The paramedics who looked after me could not have been more helpful. They were so thorough and kind as well as having a spot of humour to cheer me on Christmas Eve. I was given medication and assured that if I needed help they would be with me. Thank you South West  Ambulance Service for all that you do  in helping others.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body:
The receptionist is always polite and helpful
The doctors are kind and knowledgeable
I cannot think why I would want to go elsewhere ever

title: Great
body:
Staff on phone and on site doing exceptional work in very busy circumstances. 

We used 111 online but after 7 hours waiting for a within-the-hour call we called 111 to see if we should be doing anything different and they arranged a the urgent treatment centre to ring us back. A call an hour or two later, an appointment a couple of hours after with medicines given and a child now feeling much better and able to enjoy Christmas morning :)

I liked that staff warned us there would still be a wait even with an appointment so we could be prepared.

The doctor answered our questions (and was clear and very honest about any uncertainties etc). 

It was also great medicines were given direct to us (no need to find a pharmacy late at night on Christmas Eve) and tips given to successfully get medicines into a child were helpful.

Thank you so much

title: Great end of life cate
body: After 2 1/2 years, see my previous review, it boiled down to end of life care for my 98 yr old mother. The staff were fantastic throughout, never once was my mother left wanting. At the very end, one carer sang a gentle hymn type song, then said a prayer over her. It calmed my mother down, it was so touching, it really has changed me somehow, I don't know how! The staff were so helpful, respectful, obliging and professional in all aspects of my mother's care, they've felt like family throughout, and I'm going to miss them all terribly! Everything was explained to me. Thanks to everyone there!

author: Swift08
title: Patient Waiting Times
body:
On visiting Christmas Eve, as requested by Dr Burrows from out of hours service, my husband has an eye problem which is very painful. We weren't told how long the waiting time would be. So far its Christmas morning, we have been here now for 8hrs and my husband has only been at triage. There are 3 other patients before my husband, apparently, as he is in the same category. Well what is the category?  
We do understand that there are ambulances coming in with real life threatening emergencies...but come on Wishaw general, maybe you could think of a better way to run your department. I have seen your poor receptionists get it in the neck from some people waiting. Not fair.  
Why can you not have a designated doctor who deals with these non life threatening categories? Get them seen and get them out of A & E as quick as possible. Makes sense to me and I'm sure a lot of other people would agree. I think it is an utter disgrace to have people waiting that length of time. In my opinion, there is no excuse for the sick not being attended to in a time frame of say 2 hours.  
It is an absolute shambles.

title: Thank you
body: Happy Christmas to all the wonderful staff at Parkbury House, and thank you for providing outstanding care for our family this year. We recognise and appreciate how hard you are all working at this time of unprecedented demand on primary care.

title: Excellent Physiotherapist
body:
I received excellent care and assistance from my physiotherapist.
She was very helpful, caring and warm.
I was happy with the service I received from her.
She went above and beyond to provide me with the care I needed.

title: the best
body: this has got to be one of the best practices out there. I have even recommended other people to it. Me and my mum have never had an issue here. The doctors nurses receptionists are so friendly. They give appointments you can request prescriptions and they are at the pharmacy in a timely manner. I would not go anywhere else unless I left the city

title: Excellent service
body: Always get a prompt response no matter how busy they seem. Staff are friendly, doctors are great, too. Thank you for working so hard!

title: Extremely good and caring practice
body: A very clean place.All the people I met from cleaners to consultant had a smile and a ice word.I had cataract it took no more than 20 minutes.I’d rather go there than dentists.

title: 111 were fab
body: Called 111 around 8pm on behalf of my Nan for a recurring UTI. After a 40minute wait we finally we spoke to a Health Advisor at Hertfordshire who was incredible! He was professional, patient and very sympathetic. He was a pleasure to speak with. He referred us onto a prescribing pharmacist who gave some great advice and then onto a Doctor who prescribed antibiotics. Everything was managed within two hours. Very impressed as im sure they’re inundated at the moment with calls. Thank you for an excellent service!

title: Great practice
body:
We are all going through difficult times, but with continuing medical issues trying to get through to the surgery can be slow but with there self referral on line option on line which is available from 08:00 Monday to Friday until they are full or even phoning the surgery selecting option 1 then if you are away from being answered then select option 1 again and you keep your place in the queue and then they call you back when it’s your turn so you will always get to speak to a receptionist who will if advised you if you consider you need to speak to a doctor will send a message to the duty doctor who if it is considered important will call you back during the day. This system although not as good as the days when you could call and make an appointment still works well with the work load the doctors have day after day. 
Thank you to the staff for being there for us.

title: Terrible communications and lack of care.
body:
We called the doctors where a phone call consultation was booked again not being able to be seen face to face. We waited for the doctors call that morning which never came so that day we turned up to the surgery and refused to leave until we had our consultation which then the doctor phoned after 15 mins of being there. We were prescribed antibiotics in the short term and told our results would follow us over the phone in the next 24 hours which has still not arrived and now we’re at Xmas Eve which is day 6 after the consultation and can not get any response. 
The symptoms have not completely gone. 
Patients come 1st in everything we do is one of the NHS values yet we are not seeing this.

title: Some constructive feedback
body: Very good surgery but... and this is a big 'but' - everytime I come into the surgery the receptionists are gossping away. Even if they see patients that need serving they ignore us and continue gossiping away about personal issues. I understand we're all human and we need to left off steam, but pleeease serve me and let me sit down, and then by all means go about your day and continue your gossiping. Very unprofessional and really letting the surgery down.

title: Rudeness
body:
Up until this point, I’d like to start by saying that, generally, most of the doctors are helpful, supportive and proactive at Crofton. 
But……..I have had an ongoing problem for months, which hasn’t been resolved yet. I have been to the doctors on numerous occasions and am getting increasingly worried and worse. I booked yet another appointment last week,  in the hope that I would get help to improve my health, but when I asked if they could help me, I was just met with a very abrupt ‘no’. I now have to wait for 4 weeks for a hospital appointment. I am really struggling and will suffer a lot, waiting this long.  I got the impression that the doctor was fed up with me and wasn’t willing to listen or take a look at my problem. It’s something I believe a doctor could help me with, as I wait for a hospital appointment, and would ease my suffering. They were very rude, disrespectful and spoke down to me. I was shocked at their attitude. No one deserves to be spoken to like that, especially for just asking for help. Truly disgusting behaviour that shouldn’t be tolerated. How dare they?

title: No call
body: Having filled out the e-form regarding my symptoms I was told I would receive a call from my doctor at 4pm on the 23rd December. The call never came. I am in excruciating pain and feel totally let down by the surgery. I understand this time of year that the practice will be busy, but if I did not have the means to travel to A&E, this weekend could have been a different story. For an infection and influenza, and no call from my doctor, I am incredibly upset and frustrated. I am reluctant to use NHS services until absolutely necessary as I am aware and sympathetic to the issues facing our national health system. To be let down at a time I feel I really needed them is incredibly upsetting. I thank all medical staff and all NHS workers for all they do, but on this occasion I feel a lack of care has been shown.

title: Not fit for purpose
body:
My husband is 70 with multiple health problems, Inc COPD.
He developed a nasty cough with pains in his sides and chest from coughing.
I rang at 9m and was told a Nurse would ring in an hour. It's now 7:30 am and still no phone call

title: One can let down the whole…
body:
Received call relative was deteriorating and to visit asap .On arriving at ward ,after  no reply on intercom, twice , a member of ? clerical staff appeared on our side of the doors and asked if we had buzzed in . When I replied yes but no answer , he proceeded to swipe himself in , with no offer of assistance , only a smirk and ‘well you are well outside of visiting times!’ Then left us outside.I did say we’d been rung but he just walked away . 
Now ask yourself, ‘ well outside of visiting times’what’s the most likely explanation for 3 distressed relatives to be calling to a ward? We did not need this sarcasm at this time or complete lack of compassion .
Staff on the ward were amazing though . Communication was excellent , especially critical care outreach nurse . Relative died the next day , and, despite the staffs care, that one incident plays on my mind . So please , All Staff, clinical or otherwise , please just be kind ! It matters !
PS I am a registered nurse at this hospital , so yes, I understand security issues etc . Just could have been handled so much better .

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Like the Curates Egg, good in parts.
body:
I am 81yrs of age, & recently celebrated my last birthday in Derriford Hospital. I was there briefly for a partial hip replacement due to a fall onto icy concrete. As there were no ambulances available to take me in that day & there was too much ice to get out from our house, a neighbour with a 4 wheel drive took me in. I was placed on a gurney and taken into A&E 1 hour post trauma. I remained on the gurney in the A&E for what seemed seemed like an an eternity. Eventually after a failed theatre slot, I was on the table on my 81st birthday 2 days post trauma. I remained nil by mouth for 2 and a half days.
The food once one could get slotted into the system was delicious,& I am a very discerning eater, the staff were on the whole charming with one or two notably unpleasant exceptions. I was in and out in record time, 5 nights only.
I’m by nature politely assertive, and have the advantage of being particularly medically savvy. I have also been a lifelong devotee of regular & strenuous exercise. I observed that many of my fellow inmates were not, & almost regardless of chronology did well or poorly depending upon their motivation & insight. 
During my stay there were strikes which did not help, the staff are there, as is the expertise, it just has to be adhered into a more efficient system. All in all I’m happy with my outcome, but I had to contribute far too much to make it so. There scheduled visits are a different story and are of the highest quality and standard, the elements are there, overall efficiency still needs work.

title: Very poor service
body: Was waiting over 6 hours for them to see my young baby, my baby’s heart rate was fast and my baby had a high temperature and I was not offered any paracetamol. I had to ask for paracetamol to be given. There’s no where to breastfeed your baby and the doctor that was supposedly supposed to be seeing my baby was chilling behind me at the computer putting his feet up for the longest time before he saw any patients. The doctor prior to that was just talking away to staff and then went home. The sister on the ward did not even know what to do. Was very appalled by the service.

title: Unacceptable
body:
I was informed that my daughter was in A&E on 23rd December after having a seizure. I tried all day to phone A&E and couldn’t get a reply. I found out later through another source that she was admitted to the AMU. I was not informed even though I am her next of kin. Today I have tried numerous times to call AMU but no response. I am unable to go to the hospital because I am disabled. I really need to speak to someone to find out how she is. I am worried sick.
I find this unacceptable to cause such distress and will be making a formal complaint when it is possible.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Joke of a practice, horrible staffs
body: It's interesting how I made a review about a year ago regarding the practice and the receptionist. Coming to the practice again and noticing the same rude receptionists after ringing themearlier i was running late due to traffic, Ensure your receptionist go on communication courses and stop being passive aggressive to patients they feel they can pick on because it's appalling and for the Dr that came to 'calm the situation' by telling me not to raise my voice, maybe thats the way my voice is or you expect me to tolerate passive aggressiveness from your receptionist, to call 111 trust me I do that all the time because the practice is very unhelpful 99% of the time. If you are a GP trainee also go for a conflict resolution course, if you are a fully qualified GP then also change your ways. It's sad that after the surgery noticed the gaff they decided to call back and say the Dr was unaware I brought my child for the appointment and you later gave me an appointment that same day when i could have been seen earlier, then I am glad she didn't see us because how would I want such person to see my child when she doesn't know anything about the appointment I booked? I know this review won't change anything about the surgery because it's still the same way from a year ago but at least people who want to register at the surgery will read the reviews on her

title: Excellent service
body:
I called at 0800 am needing an emergency doctor's appointment and I had an appointment for 10.20 the same day. I was seen by a wonderful young doctor who was sympathetic and knowledgeable. She diagnosed my condition correctly and efficiently and had 
Emergency medication sent to my pharmacy and I had my medicine at 11.30 that morning. I have fully recovered and can't thank Barton hills surgery enough.

title: Terrible
body: Tried calling 111, no answer. Tried online 111, told nurse will call within 1hour, 3 hours later no call, useless service, sort it out

title: Amazing care & staff
body:
Good evening, I hope this emails finds you well.
I am just taking a moment to send a message to thank the staff and trust at Luton hospital. 

I was admitted on 24th January 2022 at approx 11.40am with what I would class as a serious leg injury. 

In a world where we are quick to criticise, it’s nice to be able to thank everyone involved from the moment I arrived at the hospital to the moment I was discharged.

I was checked in, examined and looked after instantly. There was not one single member of staff that could have made the experience any better, in fact the service and treatment I received was fit for royalty! And the team on ward 23 were amazing!

The surgeons and after care teams are incredible, from leaving theatre to being looked after on the ward, onto the after care teams removing the stitches and giving continued care to bring me back to good health. 

I can’t thank you all enough, I am eternally grateful and wish you all the very best.

title: Prediabetes course
body: Started out well enough. No physical checks done although it implied there would be. First few sessions fine but then all the emails with links to join the next session stopped along with recaps etc. A total waste of money if NHS are paying for this as you only get a few sessions

title: Overcrowded Practice
body:
This is poor practice as it has become too big to manage all the patients they have taken.  It is all about filling in questionnaires online with minimal human contact.  If you do not have access to computers you have had it! Massive waits to be seen, if you are lucky enough to actually be seen!  I did one of those electronic applications and was told I would get a phone call about six weeks later!  That is just not good enough. This was an extreme event but recurred again.  Many long waits to be seen. Their Klinik system is clumsy.  I never saw my so called case doctor.  After ongoing problems my wife and I left!
To much use is being made of auxiliary staff to asses and handle cases and I think errors are happening.  This is alright for certain things but seems to happen too often.  You end up waiting and suffer!
Rather join another practice if you can.

title: Superb service
body:
Went to the Urology department, to have a procedure . The nurse was so reassuring, went above and beyond to help me. 
The whole experience in the hospital was an excellent one.

title: Kind, caring, extremely professional!
body: I was admitted after a bad fall down some stairs with various physically injuries, especially to my head, and had to spend over a month in Neurological Rehabilitation. I just wanted to say how wonderful my care was from start to finish. The entire staff were incredibly caring and thorough, from management (who kindly took the time to look in on me regularly), the consultants (who explained my condition and treatment plan clearly) the Occupational Therapy staff (who were cheerful and patient!) the general nursing staff, (who were efficient and kind,) and the catering staff, who always provided excellent meals with humour and 'banter.' The whole unit, including the common area and dining area was kept spotlessly clean by the excellent cleaning staff, and my room was always tidy and comfortable. The whole staff made me feel looked after and safe at a very worrying time in my life. Kindness starts at the top, and the management and all of their staff should be thoroughly proud of themselves for the awesome job they are doing. Thank You So Much!

title: Great practice nurses
body: One of the practice nurses efficiently gave me an annual flu jab and cleared my ears of wax on a single visit. Good still to be hearing birds singing clearly on a Boxing Day walk!

title: Excellent service & support
body: On this particular occasion I emailed the surgery for sone advice and received a prompt and very helpful response. Indeed, having been registered here for 6/7 years I have found this to be the best medical practice that I have ever used.  All the staff are incredibly helpful and extremely competent.  I feel privileged to benefit from such excellent care.  Please pass on my thanks and appreciation to the practice via any official means that you have.  It’s a truly excellent practice and deserves to be recognised as such.  Kind regards, Mark Dutoy

author: MakeChangeHappen
title: Massive thanks to the paramedics
body:
Family member was unresponsive & 999 NI ambulance crew arrived very quickly to competently deal with a complicated situation on Christmas morning.  
Massive thanks to the paramedics who were frankly fabulous. Couldn’t have asked for better care & support! Excellent #Team #NIAmbulance #paramedics

title: Fantastic care home
body: This is a fantastic care home my brother has dementia and they really do look after him and the residents the care given is 10 out of 10. The way they look after them is excellent the home it's self is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. I can't thank them enough

title: Kind and efficient
body: Following a 111 recommendation to see urgent care at Addenbrooke's Hospital, I was given an arrival time slot within the hour. I was sent for an x-ray elsewhere in the hospital really quickly and seen by the doctor almost as soon as I got back to urgent care. It was all extremely fast and I was in and out in an hour despite it being a very busy time of year for the NHS. Everyone I encountered was very kind and efficient.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Worst service I’ve ever received
body:
As a young woman I feel as though when a problem arrises medically it is already hard enough to be taken seriously, and not dismissed as something ‘hormonal’ or ‘period’ related. I recently joined this surgery and unfortunately became very ill not long after. I developed all the symptoms of an internal infection and was given numerous urine tests. Once the doctors had told me it wasn’t an infection and that they had ruled out it wasn’t anything fatal, I was dismissed and had no follow up, even though I continued to feel unwell and told them this. I repeatedly called and asked what can be done to help me, no one was bothered or interested in helping me, even though my symptoms were so bad I could not attend university, my part time job or even get out of bed.
 I was the told by one of the doctors that my symptoms are from my anxiety, and that my anxiety could be making the symptoms up… I can’t begin to explain how frustrating it is to feel unwell and to be told you’re imagining the symptoms. I was also told that I was put down for referrals multiple times by different doctors, only to find out now that I wasn’t put down for any and that I was being continuously lied to. I’m appalled by the service I’ve received. I will not be using this surgery anymore and if anyone I know in Bath wants to be taken seriously and seen by a doctor, I would not recommend this practice.

author: Purplegiraffe
title: A brilliant team!
body:
I was under the care of the general surgical ward last week and I just wanted to commend the team. After travelling from Grampian for my procedure, from the minute I arrived on the ward to when I left I was put at ease by everyone I met.  
A huge appreciation has to go to my anaesthetist for being so caring and patient with me. We discussed my history and I put full trust in him that his plan would work. I will be forever grateful to him for taking that time with me to reassure me.  
I also had an amazing nurse Joyce who was an angel when I was back on the ward, even though I was still a little woozy after my pain relief and anaesthetic she reassured my mum and made sure I was comfortable for my journey back to Aberdeen.  
A brilliant team!!

author: Cyclingourway
title: Universally kind, sympathetic and professional
body:
I was admitted at short notice to the Day Surgery Unit for urgent shoulder surgery. The response time was superb. I was seen in the outpatient orthopaedic clinic on the Tuesday, and telephoned on Wednesday for admission at 8 am the next morning.  
From the point of admission in the morning to my discharge around 9pm I experienced outstanding care from every member of the team. After being prepared by the nursing team, I was visited by the surgeon, Mr Moses and his assistant, Nicole. I had a problematic injury and Mr Moses went through all the issues very clearly and patiently. I felt really well informed.  
The anaesthesia team were also very kind and sympathetic. I could not remember when I had last had a general anaesthetic, and they talked me fully through the process giving great reassurance.  
The next thing I knew was that I was in the recovery area being looked after, once again, by a lovely team of nurses and other support staff. Given that it was quite late in day I was offered the chance to stay overnight, and was sorely tempted given the fantastic night team. But the magnet of my own bed , along with my wife, were too tempting and so I headed home around 9pm.  
It is common these days for people to complain about our NHS. In my own case I cannot thank the team enough. They were universally kind, sympathetic and professional.  
The next stage is recovery, which I suspect is going to be down to me in large part! However, in my view, the Day Surgery Team are exceptional. Thank you.

author: Big Al 123
title: Very professional and very informative
body: Went to Victoria Hospital Orthopaedic Pre-assessment unit as I am awaiting a hip replacement surgery. The experience was excellent, Karen the nurse was superb,  very professional and very informative about all the procedures regarding the operation forthcoming. Other staff were also very nice and put me at ease quickly, again very professional and talked me through the procedures in progress.  All in all I was very happy with everything that happened. I left the pre-assessment suite with a very clear understanding of what the operation was going to entail, who would be doing the operation and all the things that would happen after. Very happy

author: cheetahex48
title: Late night Christmas visit
body: We visited the children’s ward in the early hours of Boxing Day due to our son having had sickness and diarrhea for over 36 hours. Our son has mild autism so getting obs done was very difficult and stressful for him. The nurses on shift were amazing, they gave us space, kept us informed as much as possible of our options and allowed us to have our masks removed. The doctor who came to see my son was fab, with some help we got his chest listened to and he was very spoilt with the generous gifts he was given, he especially loved the flashing bouncy ball he was launching at everyone! It was lovely the Doctor and nurses played with him and he left giggling and a smile on his face. We are so grateful for the attentiveness and care given to our son and for trying to make the experience as less stressful as possible for him and for us.

author: Jollydee
title: Eyebrows being tattooed
body: I have had Alopecia for all my life. I was referred to Camilla at Ninewells in Dundee, around 13 years ago. The process of getting my eyebrows tattooed has not been an easy one, as my skin pigmentation seems to change the colour of the tattoo very quickly. Camilla has tried all sorts to make it last longer but it doesn’t seem to make a difference, it’s my pigment. Camilla is on hand to top up when ever required, she is very patient and makes her clients feel relaxed and comfortable and I would not hesitate to recommend her.

author: User68
title: Attending A&E due to suicidal feelings due to chronic pain
body: Attended A&E four times over about five months due to feeling suicidal due to fibromyalgia pain not responding to medications - twice sent home with no emotional support, no medication, no contact to mental health support On one occasion, I was told, after telling doctor I was suicidal that this was not the place for me and it was for accidents and serious issues (despite the NHS 24 website clearly stating that suicidal thoughts and feelings were a valid reason for attending A&E). Told to contact GP surgery when open (who have done nothing for me in eight years) and advised to buy a packet of sleeping tablets over the counter.

author: kilode59
title: Always having a smile
body:
My son was recently admitted to acorn ward.  
I first spoke to Vic on the phone who was so kind and instantly helped me feel at ease. On admission Vic took us straight to a room and helped my son to keep calm with her friendly banter. Ally then took over his care through the night and then Sapana the next morning. They were brilliant, kind and caring towards myself and my son throughout his stay, nothing was too much of an ask. My son also saw four doctors during his stay, Rosie, Sarah, Annie and another I can’t remember her name sorry(she came to take blood in the morning!)All with such a lovely bedside manner. The wards were busy but I’d never have known as the care he received was quick and efficient. Thanks to the ward assistants for keeping the wards clean and tidy it was immaculate.  
Thankyou to the whole team for making his stay as good as it could be and for always having a smile as it really does make all the difference.

title: Disappointing experience
body:
This surgery has gone downhill. They will not give face to face appointments when you first call them. If you are lucky, they may see you afterwards.

I developed painful boils on my face earlier this week. I called in and was only offered an evening telephone appointment with one of the permanent doctors on Tuesday 20 December. Of course, the doctor could not see my condition over the telephone and instantly diagnosed it as cold sores. The medicines prescribed (Aclovir tablets) have not been working (and this is even on the third day of taking them). My condition was deteriorating. Only when I saw the receptionists on the afternoon of Thursday 22 December were they kind enough to suggest I call at 8am on Friday 23 December and provided a face to face appointment with one of the locum doctors. The locum doctor was very nice. I need to provide a urine sample. In the meantime, the locum doctor said my condition is likely impetigo. This is very different to cold sores.

The reason for the reluctance to see patients is apparently Coronavirus, but nobody at this surgery wears masks and people come and go. So, why are the GPs not seeing patients at this busy time of year???

title: Terrible  practice
body: Spent 2hrs ringing  surgery twice on different  occasions  to be left hanging  on line rung same number using house phone got through  in 20 minutes  spoke to doctor got no help asked for a certificate  doctor  obviously  hadn't  read notes from hospital  wrote something  completely  different  on certificate  doctor rung me for phoned appointment  it rung once then cut off  doctor never tried again  rang again on phone  for 1hr service is awful avoid used to be great  surgery sad

title: Good practice.i have never had a oroblem
body: Had asthma review,and bloods.both fine.nurses very informative. Did not feel rushed at all .making appointments not a problem

title: Quick and efficient service
body: I visited accident and emergency due to ongoing chest and stomach pains. I was fully expecting a long wait but was pleasantly surprised at how quickly I was triaged and tests were conducted. All the staff were so kind, professional and kind. The tests were very thorough to try and identify what the issue was and I’m forever grateful at the care which was given. I’d also like to thank the team at 111 who helped initially before recommending I go to accident and emergency.

title: Compassionate care
body: The GP treated me with compassion and respect at my latest appointment. The need for the procedure was clearly explained and consent obtained. Each step was explained clearly and I felt listened to and heard.

title: Brilliant.
body: Partener had a new valve and bypass surgery done together. Brilliant staff and surgeons who looked after him and sent him home.a big thank you.

title: Poor standards
body:
Some Receptionists at The Speedwell Practice are unhelpful and rude.
The Triage system is not suitable to everyone; no allowances are made to help patients that cannot get up early to fill the required form.  If missed the Receptionist does not help in anyway with appointments - one of the Receptionist's accused me of arguing (which was not the case) then cut me off when I asked to speak with my GP who was on duty.
This sort of thing cutting off patients who are not well, not able to speak to their GP should not be happening.
Practice Owners please address this urgently.  
Why is this happening?  There is no courtesy / duty of care shown to patients.

title: Fantastic Service
body: Fantastic service! Given an appointment straight away. Staff and doctor so friendly and helpful and also the service team resolved my query very quickly. Would highly recommend. Saved me a long trip out to A&E

title: Great service
body:
From arriving to leaving the outpatients day surgery the service I received was amazing to the staff on the ward to the consultant 
The consultant explained to me everything he was going to do and even came to see me after the surgery 
All the nursing staff was amazing and nothing was too much trouble even tho they was breaking up for Christmas that afternoon
I can't thank you all enough 
Amazing team

title: Terrible practice
body:
I would strongly discourage anyone from joining this practise. It’s virtually impossible to get an appointment to see a doctor; you can easily spend an hour or more on hold only to be cut off by the unhelpful reception staff or told there are no appointments left. The app they ask you to use is just as useless. I have two children under 2 years of age and have had awful experiences with both of them-my 1 year old was passed off as having Covid despite being limp, having a high temperature and vomiting. The doctor didn’t check his throat, ears, chest etc - just said it was covid and told me to give Calpol. 12 hours later we ended up in A&E where he was instantly
checked properly and we were told he had tonsillitis and a kidney infection. He was given hospital treatment for a week after. My newborn baby recently needed antibiotics and I was told the doctor had sent a prescription to the pharmacy. 24 hours later the prescription was still not there and after trying to get through to the surgery for 2 hours I eventually walked to the surgery to ask where my daughter’s prescription was. It transpired that the doctor had forgotten to write the prescription, but the receptionist was incredibly rude and kept suggesting it must have somehow been my mistake. 
I recently moved surgeries and can’t believe the difference - I can get a same day appointment easily, the hold time on the telephone is less than 5mins and the doctors are thorough, professional and reassuring. 
The only thing I would say is that my experience with the nurses at Edith Cavell was only ever positive. Other than that I think it’s a terrible GP practise.

title: No water for 8 hours
body:
I was taken by ambulance into A & E with acute flu symptoms. I was left in the corridor all night where I could have passed the flu virus onto very elderly patience in front and behind me. During my time in the Corridor not one member of staff offered me a drink although hydration is very important medically. 
Nursing care was just oxygen, stats, blood tests and swabs. Although viral flu was suspected I was not isolated from vulnerable patients.
Some elderly patients were calling out for help and staff members just walked on by as though they were deaf. How cold!
It was not until the morning staff came on shift that humanity was restored. I was isolated and then chose to be discharged.

title: Having to wait 4 months for an emergency appt
body: My back tooth broke on holiday in late October. Went to my dentist who sent an appt request to dental hospital as injections don’t work on me. To cut a long story short, following calls to 111 and another visit to my dentist plus two lots of antibiotics I rang the hospital for an emergency appt. I was told that I would be on a waiting list for about 4 months. I’ve got an abcess, a very sharp tooth which keeps cutting my tongue and am in terrific pain. I now have earache and a sore jaw. I have not had a Proper nights sleep for weeks. This is disgraceful.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional, efficient and courteous
body: Always had excellent service from this surgery.  The GP, nurse and reception staff.  I can get apps very quickly (relatively) and it feels all staff here take a genuine concern with me as an individual and with individual, personal health issues when they arise.  Highly recommended.

title: Outstanding in every way
body: I had to have an emergency  visit to Accident and Emergency also Brantham Ward.  This team is utterly amazing in every way possible. Doctors Nurses and all the team. They are dedicated, they are caring, compassionate and so hard working...they are a credit to the NHS and to Ipswich Hospital!.....well done to all.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Really great practice
body: I have been registered with Pound Hill Surgery for a few years now and can only praise them for the level of service and care myself and my husband have received. During the pandemic I've was able to get help with unexpected health issues and this was always done quickly and efficiently. True, sometimes  it’s  hard to get an appointment but that’s no different to any local practice. Staff work hard and put up with a lot of rudeness from some patients but I have only ever heard them being polite and calm in response. The doctors have always called me back in good time, arranged referrals quickly and followed up on test results asap. People here are friendly and helpful. When I tell family and friends about the service this practice delivers they are often envious as so many people seem to have issues with other local practices. I do feel, however, that it helps to be friendly and open minded when speaking to staff; if they can’t help you it makes it is easier to reach a compromise rather than to keep demanding something that just isn’t possible.

title: Fabulous Practice
body:
The Doctors and Nurses working at Leen View have cared for my very elderly parents for over six years. When my father died they went over and above to continue looking after him (although out of the surgery area once Dad moved to a nursing home for his final two weeks of life). 
My Mum has always had excellent care and the surgery have worked with the family to prevent her going into hospital - especially in the past few days before Christmas. I cannot rate the approach, care and liaison with our family enough. The reception staff are equally professional and most helpful.

title: reception and perscription
body:
if you can ever get through , in my experience never you are left to book on line for appointments that the total for the next 3 months are zero!
cant call them as no answers 
tried ordering meds on line to be mucked up again now 6 th time cant get it right still awaiting meds from order done on the 4th Dec  total distaster of a surgery !

title: Excellent care
body: I attended with my 3 year old daughter who has been diagnosed with a febrile convulsion. The entire experience was exceptional. The ambulance crew were knowledgeable and kind, as were the A&E nurses and doctors. They were efficient, child focused, friendly, knowledgeable and overall the experience was excellent. I would definitely recommend the children's A&E and have huge praise for the ambulance crew. In addition it was boxing day and everyone cared for us with kindness and a smile. A truly exceptional service. Thank you

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: TAG306
title: Amazing experience at vaccination centre
body:
Thanks for an amazing experience at the Lynebank Hospital vaccination centre.  
Quick and well explained.  
Great Drop-in service!!

author: AllyandJackie
title: Help from Paramedics: Up and Beyond call of duty
body:
One evening last week, my wife took a massive seizure ( related to brain tumour), turned blue and I had to phone 999. The ambulance arrived very quickly and gave fabulous care. This feedback is for the two paramedics follow on care and I’d be grateful if they could be acknowledged for this. We had to wait 3.5hrs outside A&E, the paramedics talked to us throughout this time, made us laugh and went and made us tea, offered to get me food, and took my wife for toilet breaks when needed. They talked to A&E staff about my wife’s complex condition and made sure I was allowed to stay with her when in A&E as she was distressed. They also got us priority access to A&E.  
They hadn’t had a break throughout their 12 hour shift but never complained, they just made sure we were ok and also myself as I was very shaken up. They kept explaining everything that was happening and my wife’s monitor readings. When in A&E they hooked my wife up to monitors as it was so busy, they wanted to make sure things would move quickly. They even came back to check on us the next day in the ward at the QEUH Glasgow.  
The paramedics name was Amy, but didn’t catch her colleagues name. They attended in Glasgow South Side and took us to QEUH Glasgow. Please pass on our gratitude for their care and compassion that night. Thank you.

author: lioner86
title: Excellent care in A&E after fall on ice
body:
Mum who is 82 years young fell on ice.  
Took her to A&E at Larbert. The care was excellent. They took her quickly and made sure that we could stay with her.  
Special shout out to Debbie who was so caring with a smile.  
Thanks to all in A&E for your kindness and care so appreciated

author: Cheryl12
title: Autism in the Emergency Department: First Class Care
body:
Had to attend ED at Altnagelvin on boxing night when my teenage son with autism who had a fall and fractured his wrist. Terence at triage was fantastic to say the least. When I explained about my son's autism and how the pain and environment was really triggering for him and asked if we could access the nurture/ multi sensory room, he was very understanding, spoke with the doctor and nurse in charge to arrange the best plan of care.  
Doctor ‘Eamonn’ arranged X-rays, and then Terence escorted us to nurture room straight after which meant our son had a quiet space to sit and the sensory environment helped him manage his pain. Once we confirmed he had a fracture Christine came and put his plaster of Paris on in the nurture room where he was most comfortable and was very understanding of his needs and behaviours. It was evident the staff were very busy but the reasonable adjustments they made meant the world to our son and us as parents. We are so grateful to the ED team on duty on boxing who went above and beyond the call of duty to deliver first class care. Thank you Terrence, Christine & Dr Eamonn and whole ED team on boxing night!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: melc16
title: Absolutely amazing care from nurse who kept our spirits up
body:
My son unfortunately had his first seizure where he was found unresponsive, such an incredibly worrying time. He was very ill and we waited in monklands for 6/7 hours where various tests were carried out.  
A nurse called Samuel in the A&E department was absolutely amazing with us, keeping our spirits up and really looking after us, he was so caring and full of optimism and incredibly kind. My son would never have got through it without his help.  
At a time where the NHS are under so much pressure and are stretched to their capacity I want to thank Samuel for making us feel that nothing was too much trouble and he was there whenever we needed him, people like him deserve full credit for the amazing job they do. We are so lucky to have this service and I will always be thankful to him for looking after us so well.  
I hope you read this Samuel , thank you so very much for all that you do. Know it is appreciated.

author: herculesqj73
title: Fantastic, kind and patient nurses and doctors
body: Was diagnosed with breast cancer …I was admitted in hospital with pneumonia and during an exam they discovered a lump on my breast ….i then got an appointment three weeks later with the breast clinic when I was seen the nurses and the doctors where fantastic kind and patience. I now going into hospital to get lump removed and I was at the pre-assessment last week and the nurses were so good, they listened to me rambling on and let me cry.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Fantastic doctors
body: I joined this practice in September after moving too the area and having a bad experience with another surgery, I have quite a lot of complex issues the drs are fantastic and the receptionists have always been helpful , my medications are done on time and if there's an issue there brilliant at rectifying it ,cant reccomend them enough

title: Perfection
body: After an RTA I spent 3 weeks in Addenbrooks. Completely faultless care. From the doctors and nurses, to the very kind staff who delivered my drinks and meals. I cannot thank you enough. You really are all amazing and a massive hug to you all xx

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Boxing Day
body: 7-8 hour wait to see a doctor. Just not acceptable, my 8 year old daughter has tonsillitis and we waiting all through the night to see a doctor which was also running super slow! Couldn’t have had more than 2 doctors on. The NHS is overwhelmed and it’s nobody’s fault but it really is something you wouldn’t expect for this country,If these waiting times are going to continue they need to upgrade to sufficient seating. A small plastic chair isn’t suitable for that length of time wait, my daughter was exhausted and nowhere comfortable for her to be able ti even sit comfortably, it’s not ok.  Drinks machine not working and neither the refreshment vending machine. The water machine isn’t maintained and it absolutely filthy. This is where my contributions go.

title: Better to go elsewhere!
body: My wife took me to A&E Northwick Park at midnight due to crushing arm and chest pain with shortness of breath. After being booked in which took 15 minutes I was called to a desk where they asked what was wrong again. After taking my temperature etc I was told I have to wait 4-5hrs for an Urgent Care Doctor? The reason the nurse wouldn’t send me to A&E was because I didn’t arrive there in an ambulance for crushing arm and chest pain. This didn’t sound right at all. My wife then took me to another hospital in Watford. Within a few minutes of arriving I was seen, vitals checked, ECG and being looked after in the ward. While I was at Northwick Park I even witnessed a gent collapse on the floor, screaming in pain. Nurses were told by countless people including my wife that he needed attention. Staff left him there and he was still on the floor in pain by the time we left. What a disgrace. Northwick Park A&E is a complete joke.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Disgusting
body: Went online they said receive a nurse call back but could take 12 hours.  20 hours later still not call back.  This was for my 12 year old

title: Terrible in all areas
body:
I was always disappointed with Penketh medical centre and when I moved out of the area and had to change practices I realised that Penketh was even worse than I thought. Dr surgery's always get bad press so I expected my new surgery to be the same as Penketh but it is nothing like it. You still have to wait in a queuing system when you call but never as long and you don't get cut off. The receptionist are always so friendly and happy to help. You get called back when you are told you will and when you go for an appointment usually as soon as you sit down in the waiting room you are called straight through. 
I have had a lot of dealings with Penketh over the last 4 months as both my parents are ill and I care for them. Every part of Penketh is so time consuming and stressful.  Most of the reception staff are rude, unhelpful and don't listen. Everytime I get prescriptions, which is a lot, something is usually wrong. I have taken paper work in, watched the person on reception photocopy it and add notes to the system. Next time I ring and after waiting for usually about 40 min to get through I am told the practice has no knowledge of what I'm talking about. I then get the paper work, drive to the practice which is 35 min drive from where I now live to hand it in again to be told when I get there that they already have the paper work. This has happened more than once. 
The practice needs a complete shake up and a new experienced manager that can try and turn it all around.  They need more full time doctors, last time I looked I think all but 1 or 2 work part-time.  
Come on Penketh , you can do better, if you don't know how to, ask for help.

title: Awful practice
body: They moan and tell you not to come to the surgery in the morning anymore and all appointments have to be booked over the phone at 8am in the morning… been sat on hold as caller number 3 in the queue for almost 2 hours this morning with no movement and no one picking up! Severe chest infection and can’t even get an appointment with your own doctors to get antibiotics, the place is a shambles! Don’t even bother trying to sign up here

Twice tried 111 online as think I am currently miscarrying and would like a nurse or Doctor call back. Cannot phone my Doctor as it started Boxing Day and today is bank hol. No call back after 24 hours. Not appropriate for me to go to A & E but website states I should seek Doctor help…. How?!?! No call back, no response and now the phone line is simply cutting off and not connecting. Get rid of this useless service and return to an area on call Doctor
